Simulation¶

dmipy_jax.simulation.monte_carlo.cylinder_sdf(position, radius, center=Array([0., 0.], dtype=float32))[source]¶

SDF for an infinite cylinder along Z-axis. Convention: <= 0 inside, > 0 outside.

dmipy_jax.simulation.monte_carlo.parallel_plates_sdf(position, width, normal_axis=0)[source]¶

SDF for parallel plates (1D restriction). width: distance between plates. Centers at 0.

dmipy_jax.simulation.monte_carlo.reflect(position, old_position, sdf_func)[source]¶

Elastic collision reflection for a particle stepping outside the SDF.

Parameters:

  • position – The proposed new position (inside the wall, SDF > 0).

  • old_position – The previous position (valid, SDF <= 0).

  • sdf_func – The Signed Distance Function.

Returns:

The position reflected back into the valid region.

Return type:

reflected_position

dmipy_jax.simulation.monte_carlo.simulate_ground_truth(geometry_sdf, initialization_func, gamma=267515250.0)[source]¶

Creates a simulation function for a specific geometry.

Parameters:

  • geometry_sdf – Function taking (x, y, z) or (3,) array returning signed distance. Convention: <= 0 is INSIDE (fluid), > 0 is OUTSIDE (wall).

  • initialization_func – Function taking (key, n_particles) returning (n, 3) initial positions.

  • gamma – Gyromagnetic ratio (Hz/T).

Returns:

Function(gradient_waveform, D, dt, N_particles, key) -> Signal

Return type:

simulate

dmipy_jax.simulation.monte_carlo.sphere_sdf(position, radius, center=Array([0., 0., 0.], dtype=float32))[source]¶

SDF for a sphere.

dmipy_jax.simulation.monte_carlo.step_particles(state, input_data, sdf_func, D, dt, gamma=267515250.0)[source]¶

Single time-step function for jax.lax.scan.

Parameters:

  • state – tuple (positions, accumulated_phase, key)

  • input_data – tuple (gradient_vector_at_t, )

  • sdf_func – function(position) -> distance

  • D – Diffusion coefficient

  • dt – Time step duration

  • gamma – Gyromagnetic ratio (default: Proton)

Returns:

Updated state output: None (or debug info)

Return type:

new_state

Scanner¶

dmipy_jax.simulation.scanner.bloch.bloch_dynamics(t, Magnetization, args)[source]¶

Bloch equation dynamics.

dM/dt = M x (gamma * B_loc) - R * (M - M_eq)

Parameters:

  • t – Time [s]

  • Magnetization – Magnetization vector M(t) [Mx, My, Mz]

  • args – Tuple containing: T1: Longitudinal relaxation time [s] T2: Transverse relaxation time [s] gradient_func: function G(t) -> [Gx, Gy, Gz] (T/m) B1_func: function B1(t) -> [B1x, B1y] (Tesla) (RF pulse) position: Position vector r [x, y, z] (m) delta_B_inhom: Field inhomogeneity (Tesla)

Returns:

Rate of change of magnetization

Return type:

dMdt

dmipy_jax.simulation.scanner.bloch.simulate_acquisition(phantom, sequence, duration, max_steps=10000000)[source]¶

Simulates MRI acquisition.

Parameters:

  • phantom – Object with .positions (N, 3), .T1 (N,), .T2 (N,), .B0_inhom (N,)

  • sequence – Object with .gradients (steps, 3), .rf (steps,), .dt (float) (Assuming discrete waveforms for now, will interp)

  • duration – Total duration (s)

  • max_steps – Maximum number of solver steps (default: 10^7)

Returns:

Complex sum sum(Mx + iMy)

class dmipy_jax.simulation.scanner.objects.IsochromatPhantom(positions: Float[Array, 'N_spins 3'], T1: Float[Array, 'N_spins'], T2: Float[Array, 'N_spins'], M0: Float[Array, 'N_spins'], off_resonance: Float[Array, 'N_spins'])[source]¶

Bases: Module

Represents a phantom composed of isochromats (independent spins).

T1: Float[Array, 'N_spins']¶
T2: Float[Array, 'N_spins']¶

class dmipy_jax.simulation.scanner.objects.PulseSequence[source]¶

Bases: Module

Abstract base class for pulse sequences.

get_gradients(t: Float[Array, '']) → Float[Array, '3'][source]¶

Returns the gradient vector at time t.

get_rf(t: Float[Array, '']) → Complex[Array, ''][source]¶

Returns the RF pulse amplitude (complex) at time t.

class dmipy_jax.simulation.scanner.objects.TrapezoidalGradient(amplitude: Float[Array, '3'], flat_time: Float[Array, ''], ramp_time: Float[Array, ''], start_time: Float[Array, ''])[source]¶

Bases: PulseSequence

A simple trapezoidal gradient waveform.

amplitude: Float[Array, '3']¶
flat_time: Float[Array, '']¶
get_gradients(t: Float[Array, '']) → Float[Array, '3'][source]¶

Calculates the gradient at time t for a trapezoidal shape.

get_rf(t: Float[Array, '']) → Complex[Array, ''][source]¶

No RF for a gradient object.

ramp_time: Float[Array, '']¶
start_time: Float[Array, '']¶
class dmipy_jax.simulation.scanner.sequences.GeneralSequence(time_points: Array, gradients: Array, rf_amplitude: Array, rf_phase: Array, adc_mask: Array)[source]¶

Bases: NamedTuple

Represents a general sequence defined by arbitrary waveforms.

This is the target for PyPulseq conversion where full waveform fidelity is needed.

adc_mask: Array¶

Alias for field number 4

gradients: Array¶

Alias for field number 1

rf_amplitude: Array¶

Alias for field number 2

rf_phase: Array¶

Alias for field number 3

time_points: Array¶

Alias for field number 0

class dmipy_jax.simulation.scanner.sequences.SpinEchoSequence(TE: float, TR: float, gradients: Array)[source]¶

Bases: NamedTuple

Represents a standard Spin Echo sequence for simulation.

This is a simplified representation commonly used in analytical models and fast benchmarks.

TE: float¶

Alias for field number 0

TR: float¶

Alias for field number 1

gradients: Array¶

Alias for field number 2
